reviews.text: We stayed at Nh Berlin-Mitte Hotel for two nights in late August, 2006. The hotel is modern and located in what was formerly East Berlin, so the surrounding area still bears some of the effects of many years of communist control. In the past few years, however, the area has undergone extensive development in certain areas. The hotel is convenient to the Friedrichstrasse shopping district and some other Berlin sites, such as Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel itself is attractive, the rooms are of ample size, clean, modern and comfortable. The restaurant offers good food. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return if in Berlin.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for stay in Berlin

likes.liked: — The hotel was convenient, clean, modern and comfortable.

reviews.title: A superb stay
reviews.text: The NH Berlin Mitte is outstanding. This four star superior hotel has everything you need in a city hotel. My room was very spacious, stylishly, decorated and very quiet. There was a comfortable leather chair to relax in and plenty of cupboard space. Breakfast was rather expensive, but there is a Starbucks and a bakery less than 5 minutes away.

Many good things about the NH Mitte. First- GREAT LOCATION. The hotel is around the corner from the Stadmitte U-Bahn stop, which makes it easy to get around the city. It is also near Checkpoint Charlie, the old Luftwaffe headquarters and the Holocaust Memorial and within walking distance (30-40 minutes) to the Reichstag nad Brandenberug Gate.
reviews.title: Solid choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, modern and hotel is in a quite part of town, however the bed was a bit thin and lumpy. However after walking all day long, it didn't take much for me to fall asleep. Breakfast is also expensive, and I did not find a nearby restaurant to get breakfast.
reviews.title: Has A/C but don't make collect calls!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a solid choice, allbeit a bit expensive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights when in Berlin for the Love Parade. Fantastic location, very friendly staff, but most notable of all it had the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in in a hotel.....Rooms were a good size, and very clean. Didn't have breakfast, it seemed a bit overpriced at 16 euros, especially considering the number of great cafes in the area.
reviews.title: Most comfortable hotel room bed ever

reviews.text: The only negative thing I could say about this hotel was the lack of tea/coffee making factlities in the room....what can I say, I'm British.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.text: Other than that,Berlin is a brilliant city. We will certainly return, to both Berlin and this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, good quality for money
Fantastico!
reviews.text: The hotel is situated right in the city centre. There is an underground station nearby and it's just a couple of minutes' walk to a lot of sights such as Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, Deutscher Dom, Brandenburger Tor etc. Breakfast was great and the rooms are spacious and very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. If we go to Berlin again we will definitly stay at this hotel again!

A large group of us stayed in this hotel over the New Year Bank Holiday Weekend. The communal areas were swanky and welcoming and without exception the staff were very friendly, booking taxis to the airport and giving helpful tips thoughout our stay etc
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.text: It was the little touches that really made my impression of the hotel. We were due to check out on New Year's Day and were allowed to keep our rooms until 3pm without additional charge. In addition the brunch on our last day was extended until 2pm to allow for a lie in after the inevitable big night out before. They even let us put the english footie on in the bar until we went to the airport.
reviews.title: eh... could have been better
disappointing
reviews.text: The breakfast was plentiful and varied. The rooms were amazingly clean, comfy and well stocked (lots of storage space, hangers, hairdryer, sat TV, free safe, lots of mirrors, freebie toiletries)
The location was perfect, we got one tube during the entire trip and walked everywhere else. I would certainly stay again and would recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: good quality but no charme

likes.liked: — the location in the very heart of Berlin-Mitte

reviews.text: It was in a terrific location. The hotel was really pretty. The resturant was really nice.... yummy food. When you got to the actual room though it was a little too frigid and uncomfortable. The beds were nice, but kind of stark. I would stay here again though. The staff was really nice and helped with our maps.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and central

likes.disliked: — no tea/coffee making facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located in a very nice area of Berlin. I believe this area used to be bad when the Berlin wall was still up. It is possible to walk from there to the main Berlin attractions (not a short walk though). The hotel service is average. The hotel looks very new and the room was excellent, with a nice interior design. The room was also spacious and clean. There are a couple restaurants very close by and a big shopping area at 10 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Nice and modern hotel
